comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustave_F._Touchard He was born in New York on January 11, 1888. At the US Nationals, Touchard paired with Raymond D. Little to win the 1911 doubles title and reach the 1912 doubles final. At the tournament now known as the Cincinnati Masters, Touchard won the 1912 singles title over Richard H. Palmer. He reached the singles final in 1913 losing to William S. McEllroy. He won the National Indoor title three consecutive years (1913, 1914 & 1915) and won the singles title at the New Jersey state championship in 1915. In 1912, he reached the final of the US Clay Court Championship, losing to Richard Norris Williams. He joined the Royal Air Force. He died in 1918 in Toronto General Hospital of a throat operation. His opponent: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4909923217/in/set-72157603624867509/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: On Feb 13, 1914, NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9903E5DD1E39E633A... reported, "The annual indoor national lawn tennis championship tournament in singles and doubles opened yesterday on the floor courts at the Seventh Regiment Armory, Sixty-sixth Street and Park Avenue, when fifty-four matches in singles were decided." NYT of Feb 24, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9505EFD91730E733A... reported, "Gustave F. Touchard defended his title of indoor lawn tennis champion of the United States yesterday on the Seventh Regiment Armory courts, Sixtysixth Street and Park Avenue, when he defeated Dr. William Rosenbaum after a grueling match 3 sets to 1 by the score of 6-2, 6-2, 4-6, 6-2."

comment._content: Thanks to both of you. We'll fill in the name in the caption, and add the date next time we update the record.
